## Introduction
Pele, whose full name is Edson Arantes do Nascimento, is a Brazilian former professional football player and is widely regarded as one of the greatest footballers of all time. Born on October 23, 1940, in Três Corações, Brazil, Pele's impact on the sport and his numerous achievements have made him an iconic figure in the world of football.

## Key Terms
- Football: A sport played between two teams of eleven players, where the objective is to score goals by kicking a ball into the opposing team's net.
- World Cup: An international football tournament held every four years, featuring teams from around the world.

## Detailed Life
Pele began playing football at a young age and quickly gained recognition for his exceptional skills. He made his professional debut at the age of 15 for Santos FC, a Brazilian club, and soon became a key player for both the club and the Brazilian national team.

Throughout his career, Pele achieved numerous milestones and set records that still stand to this day. He won three FIFA World Cups with the Brazilian national team in 1958, 1962, and 1970, becoming the only player to have achieved this feat. Pele's performances in these tournaments showcased his incredible talent and contributed to Brazil's success.

Little Known Facts
- Pele scored a total of 1,283 goals in 1,366 games throughout his career, making him one of the highest-scoring players in football history.
- He was named FIFA World Player of the Century in 1999, recognizing his immense impact on the sport.
- Pele played his last professional match in 1977, retiring from the sport at the age of 36.

## Examples
Pele's influence on football can be seen through his remarkable performances and achievements. During the 1970 World Cup, Pele showcased his skills by scoring four goals and providing key assists, leading Brazil to victory. His ability to control the ball, dribble past defenders, and score goals made him a formidable force on the field.

Historical Context
Pele's career took place during a time when football was rapidly growing in popularity around the world. His success and charisma helped elevate the sport's status and attract a global audience. Additionally, Pele's achievements coincided with a period of political and social change in Brazil, providing a sense of national pride and unity during challenging times.

Questions and Answers
1. Q: How many World Cups did Pele win?
   - A: Pele won three FIFA World Cups with the Brazilian national team.

2. Q: What is Pele's full name?
   - A: Pele's full name is Edson Arantes do Nascimento.

Family-Friends
Pele has been married three times and has several children. He has maintained strong relationships with his family throughout his life. In addition, Pele has formed close friendships with fellow footballers and has been a respected figure within the football community.

Quotes

- "Enthusiasm is everything. It must be taut and vibrating like a guitar string."
- "The more difficult the victory, the greater the happiness in winning."
